How did BRI's professional development programs help an educator teaching English as a Second Language? BRIs Teacher Fellowship allowed Bridget Jordan to deepen her understanding of civics and civic education while also thinking of innovative ways for her students to achieve their goals. After meeting with other BRI Teacher Fellows, Jordan said she not only [grew] as a teacher but also contributed to a community of educators dedicated to promoting civic literacy and engagement. We are excited to announce the generous donation of "We the People" and "The First Amendment" from The Printing Industry of the Carolinas (PICA). These works honor the legacy of print in shaping our democracy and coincide with our Power of the Printed Word campaign. PICA generously helped to distribute thousands of pocket constitutions to students across North and South Carolina. Their continued support ensures students have access to the Constitution.
